title: 4 injured in Gilpin Court shooting
content:
Four people were injured in a shooting Sunday afternoon in the Gilpin Court housing project.
Richmond police responded to the 200 block of West Hill Street at 3:46 p.m. and found four people with injuries that were not life-threatening.
One person was shot in the back, two were shot in the leg and the fourth had been grazed by a bullet, said Richmond police Lt. Faith Flippo.
Investigators do not have suspect information and have not released any information surrounding the circumstances of the shooting.
"We ask the community if they know anything to come forward or call Crime Stoppers," Flippo said.
The number for Crime Stoppers is (804) 780-1000.
